title: Death toll in great earthquakes as of 2016
summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Earthquake, and Death toll in each Earthquake on the y axis.
The maximum Death toll 242000.0 is found at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and the minimum is found at Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) where Earthquake is 73338.0.
The difference of Death toll between the highest and lowest Earthquake is 168662.0.
min_summary: This is a bar chart representing Earthquake in the x axis and Death toll in the y axis.
Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has the highest Death toll and Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) has the lowest Death toll.
mid_summary: This bar chart has 10 columns on the x axis representing Earthquake, and Death toll in each Earthquake on the y axis.
The maximum Death toll 242000.0 is found at Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) and the minimum is found at Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) where Earthquake is 73338.0.
The difference of Death toll between the highest and lowest Earthquake is 168662.0.
max_summary: This is a bar chart representing Earthquake in the x axis and Death toll in the y axis.
Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has the highest Death toll and Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) has the lowest Death toll.
Second maximum Death toll is found at Earthquake Haiti (2010).
The difference of Death toll between the highest and lowest Earthquake is 168662.0.
The Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) has the highest Death toll, followed by Haiti (2010), and Nanchang (China 1927). Down to the Earthquake Muzaffarabad (Pakistan 2005) which is the lowest.
The Earthquake Tangshan (China 1976) tends to be 1.61 percent higher than average.
The Death toll is 1499092.0 if we add up values of all Earthquakes.
